def not_so_random(b,w):
    # If both b and w are zero, then there are no marbles left.
    # In this case, we cannot predict the color of the last marble.
    if b == 0 and w == 0:
        return "Unsure"
    
    # If b and w are both odd or both even, then we can predict the color of the last marble.
    # This is because every pair we remove will have different colors, and we will always be left with a black marble.
    if b % 2 == w % 2:
        return "Black"
    
    # If b is odd and w is even, or b is even and w is odd, then we cannot predict the color of the last marble.
    # This is because at least one pair we remove will have the same color, and we will be left with a white marble.
    return "Unsure"
3:
def not_so_random(b,w):
    # If there are no black marbles, the last marble will be white
    if b == 0:
        return "White"
    
    # If there are no white marbles, the last marble will be black
    if w == 0:
        return "Black"
    
    # If the number of black marbles is greater than or equal to the number of white marbles
    # the last marble will be black
    if b >= w:
        return "Black"
    
    # If the number of black marbles is one less than the number of white marbles
    # the last marble will be white
    if b + 1 == w:
        return "White"
    
    # If none of the above conditions are met, the last marble color is uncertain
    return "Unsure"

def not_so_random(b, w):
    # if there are no black marbles, the last marble will be white
    if b == 0:
        return "White"
    
    # if there are no white marbles, the last marble will be black
    if w == 0:
        return "Black"
    
    # if there is an even number of marbles, the last marble will be black
    if (b + w) % 2 == 0:
        return "Black"
    
    # if there is an odd number of marbles and more black marbles than white marbles,
    # the last marble will be black
    if b > w:
        return "Black"
    
    # if there is an odd number of marbles and more white marbles than black marbles,
    # the last marble will be white
    if w > b:
        return "White"
    
    # if there is an odd number of marbles and an equal number of black and white marbles,
    # we cannot predict the color of the last marble
    return "Unsure"

4:
def not_so_random(b,w):
    # if there are no marbles, return "Unsure"
    if b == 0 and w == 0:
        return "Unsure"
    # if there are only black marbles, return "Black"
    if b > 0 and w == 0:
        return "Black"
    # if there are only white marbles, return "White"
    if b == 0 and w > 0:
        return "White"
    # if there are both black and white marbles, return "White"
    return "White"

print(not_so_random(5, 0))
print(not_so_random(2, 2))
